definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: They are farmers whose forefathers lived on this land.
sentences.chinese: 祖辈辈都住居在这片土地上的农民。

sentences.english: We don't see it if we look at our grandparents, but it's there.
sentences.chinese: 如果看我们的祖辈，还是看不到进化，但它的确存在。

sentences.english: Our family have been farmers for generations .
sentences.chinese: 我家祖祖辈辈都是农民。

sentences.english: Like generations of immigrants before them, they came to America seeking economic opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 像他们的祖祖辈辈一样，他们到美国来寻找机会。

sentences.english: I can remember all the family history and traditions that were passed along.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得所有祖祖辈辈传下来的家族历史和传统。

sentences.english: Yellow mother's milk for generations nurtured the growth of the people here.
sentences.chinese: 黄河母亲的乳汁哺育了祖祖辈辈生长在这里的人民。

sentences.english: About 20 people, for generations are living in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 约20户人家，他们祖祖辈辈都是住在大山上。

sentences.english: Palin’s roots are in the American West.
sentences.chinese: 佩林家的祖辈是美国西部人。

sentences.english: Buck insisted that our grandparents’ world belongs also to us.
sentences.chinese: 赛珍珠坚持说，我们祖辈的世界也属于我们。

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
